intro: Holcosorus pentagonus, commonly known as the five-angled clubmoss, is a species of small, evergreen plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, dense growth habit and its distinctive, club-like sporophylls that are arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its leaves are linear and often arranged in two rows, contributing to its neat appearance. Holcosorus pentagonus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
